subject: Re: Deploy Perl script on Windows
body:
On Jun 8, 5:27 pm, chas.ow...@gmail.com (Chas Owens) wrote:
> On 6/8/07, Octavian Rasnita  wrote:
>
> > Search forPARon search.cpan.org.
>
> Having just done this, I can tell you that thePARshipped by
> ActiveState is not up topar.  You will need to installPARandPAR::Packer manually.  I don't believe there are any XS based modules,
> so you should be able to just copy nmake* to somewhere in your path
> and run*
>
> perl -MCPAN -e installPAR::Packer

Unfortunately, to install PAR::Packer from source, you *do* need a C
compiler. You can either install the free MinGW set of tools or you
can install a PAR::Packer binary from the bribes.org or
http://theoryx5.uwinnipeg.ca/ppms/ instead.

Best regards,
Steffen
